Reviews.Title: “Better to take a cheap guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: clotilde p
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, but that's the only thing the hotel has to offer. The room (single) I rented was extremely small but that is quite normal for HK. However it was not only small but also very stinky and noisy (no isolation). Bathroom is ridiculous, you have to have you shower on the towel bowl. Absolutly not recommanded for overweight persons. The location is good but could be better. To sum up if you are looking for comfort better to take a star rated hotel (some are nearly the same price). If not there are some great and much cheaper place close the harbour that have better value than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellent Location, but small small small!”
Reviews.Author: booyah27
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this hotel except that the cheapest standard double room I got was just too tiny for two people. For one person it would have been totally fine though. I am not luxury traveller, and to be honest my standards are fairly low! I am chinese myself too. The washroom is just a glass enclosed room. The door doesn't even go all the way up to the ceiling! Therefore, there is no sound privacy. The shower faucet is placed such that when you use it absolutely EVERYTHING in the washroom will get drenched in water. The washroom is just that small. Everything else is fine. Beds, TV, cleanliness is all great. A great bonus is free wifi internet and free local phone calls! Overall this is hotel is VERY good value if you don't mind it cramped a bit. In HK, hotels are generally not too cheap so this is one of your few low-budget options. Keep in mind that I stayed by myself in an upgraded room (king suite?) a few years back at this same hotel and the experience was much better. The price reflected that too though.

Reviews.Title: “Fair stay”
Reviews.Author: SeanXM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the Yau Ma Tei metro exit on the busy Nathan road, the Metro has direct connections to the Hong Kong Island (towards Admiralty and Central). The hotel surroundings offer many local restaurants as well as fast food chain such as McD and Yoshinoya. The hotel reception was on the second floor and there are two small lifts (each lift fits 4 slim person) taking you there as well as to the room floors. The receptionist were not directly friendly but it seems they are really stressed by the daily work apart from guests checking in/checking out and my check in procedure was efficient though without any trouble. The hotel guests consist of many mainlaind Chinese from different part of China, I guess this hotel standard suits the middle class mainland Chinese tourists well. The single bed room was OK and it is not that small stated from some people here, I had a lot more space than only a suitcase, the desk is not spacious but enough to work with a laptop computer. The toilet was relatively bad (this was expected) since the whole toilet is the dedicated shower spot so you will stand in front of the toilet chair when the action begins. From the window it is the back street of Nathan road with some high-rises but its very quiet at the night (I stayed on the 7th floor). The second evening I saw someone installing a new Wifi router on the corridor and after that the Wifi cannot be connected anymore, I went to the reception and the receptionist gave me another login credential (he is well prepared, I guess many asked for that before). The hotel café is on the third floor and it offers breakfast for around 30 HKD, it has several menus to choose from all from English/continental/HK style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale”
Reviews.Author: Yodada
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the location. You just can't beat the great convenience of Nathan Road and Yau Ma Tei areas. Yes, the rooms are very small, the smallest of all the hotels/motels we have ever stayed in, but we were mentally prepared after looking at all the reviews. My husband & I stayed for 4 nights here. We just used it for a few hours each night so it was not too bad. The maid did a great job of keeping the room & bathroom clean with all our luggage(after a 15 day trip to China)there. Air Conditioner worked like a charm. Nothing to complaint. A21 bus to the airport was just 1/2 block away. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it...”
Reviews.Author: JomTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week... We booked it online 7 months ago which we considered at a very good rate. Since it is HongKong, already expected the room to be small but is well 'equipped' with, cable channels, hair dryer, kettle, free wifi.. no mini-bar or safe. 30 secs from YauMaTei mtr. Towels are change on daily basis (so long as just leave them on the floor, housekeeper will replace with new). We stayed facing the backstreet, thus having good sleep every nite. They do provide meals but we didn't try it as we are exploring local foods.. 7 eleven just few steps aways, supermarket just the opposite... The well known street "Miu Kai" just behind the hotel. Oh yes, few steps away from the hotel is the bus stop which have airport shuttle bus no. A21, costing hkd33 only instead of taking a taxi costing hkd300... If not staying need to Mongkok subway, will stay here again for my next trip....

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, small but it's Hong Kong we're talking about.”
Reviews.Author: tamkiapo
Reviews.Content: After searching for weeks, all hotels in Hong Kong are either way too expensive or way out-of-the-way. Casa is, by far, the cheapest with the most convenient location I could find online. We paid in full for 3 nights upon check in and the curency was converted on the spot when my Malaysia issued credit card was swiped. For the first time, in using credit card at foreign country, I was getting such a disadvantageous exchange rate. To be fair, I don't know which party (hotel or HK bank or my bank) was to blamed. As for our standard double room, it was very small, comparable to Tune Hotel London that I stayed last summer. It took a little practice to figure out how to shut the bathroom door with me inside and how to wash my long hair in it. My tips? Remove the dustbin and extra towels from the toilet for more space. On first morning, we were woken up by noisy neighbour and their children running and shouting along the corridor. Luckily they checked out on that day. Cleanliness was overall ok and I did not get any bed bugs bite. The cleaner is helpful and friendly. I was very satisfied with the location of Casa Hotel. Yau Ma Tei MTR station entrance is just a few steps away and there's a lot of bus stops nearby, including the stop for Airport shuttle bus. We walked to the busiest shopping streets (Fa Yuen, Sai Yeong Choi & Tung Choi streets) every night and Langham is not that far if one is willing to walk. Finding food is never a problem here. One thing you might want to know that, Portland street is right behind the hotel. There are a lot of eateries here but also many prostitutes standing at the street. However, they did not pose any problem to us and basically the place is quite safe even for a single lady to walk (as long as she dressed decently). Upon checked out, they were very willing to store our luggage while we went out for more shopping. I know a lot of hotels provide this service, but Casa actually helped us to store luggage in a proper storage room, instead of just leaving them at the lobby/reception area. All in all, I would recommend this place to anyone on tight budget and only looking for a clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Nickcom
Reviews.Content: Hotel is overly expensive for a single (truly single - bed is only for 1) room, even by Hong Kong standards. Location is perfect - seconds from subway and over a convenience store. The bed is very firm but comfortable, pillows are not. Exceptionally clean. Bathroom/shower/toilet is the smallest I have ever witnessed but does the job fine. Biggest downside is that there is seemingly no noise insulation to the hallway meaning your sleeping patterns are at the mercy of you neighbours sharing the floor with you. And being Hong Kong you are likely to get woken up at least once. Stupidly designed twin elevators that operate independently mean that patrons press the buttons for both elevators and take the first to arrive, leaving the other elevator to stop on all floors on the way down so be prepared for a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: qasr
Reviews.Content: Great bchoice if you want to be in the heart of this bustling, vibrant city that never sleeps. Eateries a plenty, convenience stores, retail shops all at your doorstop, not to mention the subway stop is just around the corner. It's cheap compared to other places, but that's because the rooms are small. The bathrooms are even tinier. Bigger people beware. Average-sized people can just barely get the door closed behind them, and there is no tub nor shower stall in the Standard Twin room bathroom. Rather, there's just the showerhead hovering above the toilet. My other knocks against this hotel would be that the rooms had the lingering smell of smokers, and rooms are extremely non-soundproof. Also, the 2 elevators are incredibly slow and small. Have fun waiting when everyone is checking out in the morning. Great choice of hotel if you just want a place to sleep and don't mind an older building, and if you can get it early at a good rate as I did. Clean enough facilities, service not bad.

Reviews.Title: “cheap. ok value.”
Reviews.Author: steveblower
Reviews.Content: It is in a really convenient location for shops and transport. A21 airport bus stops virtually outside. Even though just me staying, the single room is just too small. The double, which I took this time, was better, but it would be a struggle for 2 people and 2 suitcases, I think. Free wifi at rocket speed, in the room, which is very welcome indeed.For the odd night, from time to time, it is fine. Front desk staff are very slick but I have never ever seen one of them smile.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: D L
Reviews.Content: Very good location as just next to mtr exit. But noisy, noise from the traffic and other rooms. Not recommended for light sleeper like me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Value for Money, Good Location and Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Utscafe
Reviews.Content: Abt USD100 for a clean two single bedroom in the city location, 1 min talk to train station. Many restaurants & 7-11 nearby.. Front Desk was useful. Bathroom is a bit small but who cares if I can save so much $ for shopping !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for anyone touring Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Batikh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on top of the Yau Ma Tei Subway stop. It is mere steps away from the north end of the Temple Street night market (not the gateway part). It is ON Nathan Road! Walking distance to the Ladies Market. We did it all from this hotel, Disneyland, Central, Kowloon, Stanley and more. The room was tight for us (but we had three adults and two toddlers) with out the extra bed it would have been fine. It is a typical Hong Kong hotel room. There was also a great Vietnamese restaurant (served 333!) across the road. There were fruit shops and a convenience store on the corner. The Wellcome grocery store was 2 blocks north which was good for breakfast and snack stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Snobby Staffs”
Reviews.Author: GraceLing
Reviews.Content: No doubt Casa has good location and nearby to subway station. The front desk staffs do not seems like aware they are in hospitality industry and there is no customer service to guest. Front desk staffs not even care to head up to have eye contact when guest stepped in and in front of them to have conversation and checking on direction. I was stayed there for 4 nights the aircon did not working (outside average daily temperature was hitting 30Ç), complaint to the front desk and no one come to fix it. I have been travelling a lot for business and leisure, domestically and abroad but had never encountered such a bad service hotel staffs. Advise you stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with a good price”
Reviews.Author: Evonne L
Reviews.Content: I lived in this hotel for around three days. Their service was just okay, especially their receptionist. They were not patient with my question, I understand they have a lot to deal with. The room was quite small, even for Hong Kong standard. The hallway smells, it has a strong detergent sell, which makes me so sick. But honestly, their location is very good. It is convenient for everything. I still had the jet lag when I first arrived at the hotel, so I felt hungry during the night. But street food and night market is just a block away from the hotel. Additionally, it is very close to the subway station, like 3 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service staffs are not helpful”
Reviews.Author: suzanneksy
Reviews.Content: 03may2012 Yes, the hotel is very convenient to everywhere but the price is too expensive that we can get 4/5stars hotel in same price. The customer service staffs are not helpful & not friendly at all. Very bad service. The rooms are terribly small & aircon is not cold anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, for the location”
Reviews.Author: Miche1e
Reviews.Content: If I return to Hong Kong I will stay at this hotel again, for it's convenience. Situated in the heart of Kowloon, it's location is superb. RIght by an MTR, walking distance to Mongkok. There are many cheap eating places nearby and very close to Temple Street Night Market. Kowloon was definitely the more affordable side of Hong Kong to stay on in terms of meals. The room was nice. The worst part about the hotel was the tiny bathroom, which felt like a small wardrobe. You were almost showering on top of the toilet and basin. The staff weren't particularly friendly, but we got what we needed. There's no breakfast included. It really is just a place to sleep, but it's comfortable and in good condition. There's free wifi in the rooms, if you have your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and small”
Reviews.Author: Hogiekj58
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has said, the rooms are tiny and bathrooms are only about 1 metre x 1 metre, but it's Hong Kong. I"d love to know where someone is going to find much more for the price. I think the A21 bus from the airport which stops on Nathan Road (stop 9) across the road from the hotel seems better value than the MTR . Fresh towels, bed made, good value.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: prettyme985
Reviews.Content: everyone is right it is conviencing located at the perfect area.but honestly for the price that we are paying we can get a 5 star at the same price.the rooms are terribly small and isnt easy even if u have just 2 suitcases.our bags were nt huge but yet we had to open one at a time and jump over them to actually get across the room.we booked on a high floor so we didnt hear the traffic but the walls are very thin and can actually hear the next doors tv and their conversation and oh gosh the bathrooms were very small.worse thani have ever seen.not evn a bathroom in india wud look like that.i suggest the city view hotel which is also convenient,

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MariaFrancescaNZ
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel in Hong Kong that is absolutely in the right location. It is a two minute walk as you get out of Yau Ma Tei metro station. The rooms are really tiny as the case of hotels in HK but if your visit is to explore HK the whole day and just retire at night this is definitely a hotel value for money. Ask a room not along Nathan Road as it could be noisy if you are trying to get a good rest. The newly opened cafe that serves breakfast is also a real value for money, clean and restful environment. The bathroom is the real issue. In all my travels, I have not seen a bathroom configured as this. Be sure to bring out all your stuff before you start having your shower. This real value of this hotel is its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Midnight check-in.”
Reviews.Author: limong
Reviews.Content: Due to last minute decision, we ( my dear sis and I) decided to have a fun eating trip in HK. Got a good deal with MAS ( they landed 20 minutes earlier at HK) and we still get to catch a bus at 11pm and reaching hotel close to 12 midnight. We were given a room at 14th floor, checked out the room which was at the back of hotel and were not pleased with it because it was cramped and closed to the other building wall. Went down to reception which was manned by a elderly grey- haired man (wearing a normal collared white shirt - I presumed a senior post) and he was not pleased telling us off that this will be the last change or just paid HK220 to upgrade to a better room! We reasoned with him that we wanted a room facing the front(Nathan Rd) and was given a room at 12th floor. Again its a room at the back and even scary with a leading stairway at the next building. Fed up we went down again and told him to change our room to our request( in fact before our departure I had email to them about our needs) and he still tried to ask us to upgrade. Finally a nice guy(wearing coat) after hearing all the fuss came over to tell us that he will personally take us to room 709 to check whether we like the room. Now this is definitely a better room and this time it faced Nathan Rd. So if you do meet this greyed hair man who in fact looks friendly but nasty-beware! He only manned the reception at night. So we had a cozy room and yes a SMALL toilet/bathroom but the water pressure was good. Staying 3 nights we checked out at 4a.m to catch the 8.45 flight back to Malaysia. And you never have to worry about paying an exorbitant taxi fare coz their bus to airport ply 24 hours! GREAT FOOD & SHOPPING- Hong Kong we will still be back!

Reviews.Title: “Small in size and great in location”
Reviews.Author: Whitney1214
Reviews.Content: The biggest drawcard for Casa Hotel is the location, right in the heart of Yau Ma Tei and two steps away from YMT station as well as accessible via the A21 Airport Bus; food everywhere and Mong Kok Ladies Market/Sport Shoe Market/Fa Yuen St Markets/Temple St Markets close by, it was super convenient! We spent 6 days in Hong Kong and pretty much tried all the local cuisine in that time period and our shopping bags were bulging! The main thing with Casa is the size of the rooms, a two person bedroom is TINY; and the showerhead stands over the toilet so essentially everything inside the toilet gets wet when you take a shower; I'm surprised there's not much mould around given how humid it is and how long clothes take to dry inside the hotel. By the time both visitors open up their trunks there is barely any space to walk. Also the TV doesn't have a broad range of channels. However if you were planning to pretty much only use the hotel for shower/sleep, then this place is definitely one of the more affordable ones to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap -- That's It”
Reviews.Author: jt1929
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find decent hotel rooms in Hong Kong at the lower end of the price scale. We booked Casa for one night knowing that we weren't going to be in the hotel room much. Overall, we were happy with the property and the value. (We booked at less than a week's notice and paid about US$120.) The location is prime, right above the MTR station and along Nathan Road. Temple Street night market is about 10 minutes walk, Knutsford Steps, Kowloon Park and other great stuff is all further down Nathan Road. The rooms are indeed small, but we didn't feel cramped. Beds were softer than we've come to expect (a good thing) and there were extra pillows in the closet. TV was a little 19" LCD with horrible English selection, so don't plan on watching much. Bathroom was tiny, so I suspect a twin room would be a bit awkward for two less well-acquainted people, but perfectly functional and reasonably clean. Casa Hotel is cheap, has a great Kowloon location and is basic and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSim
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for the 2nd time. location is the main draw for Casa. it is located along mongkok area and just 5 to 10 mins walk from the ladies street. it is 1 min away from Yaw Ma Te MTR station. rooms are pretty small especially the toilet. one do not have much room to move at all in the toilet. it is the smallest toilet i have ever come across in my entire life. you will not have enough space to open up your luggage in the room. you have to open it up on your bed instead.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, very near MTR”
Reviews.Author: Sungirl89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I went to HK with my family. I got the cheapest room for me and my hubby. As expected, the room is tiny. The sides of the double bed are almost pushed to the two walls of the room. When hubby and I open our luggage, there is no more space in the room for us to walk around. Just fair with the cost that I paid. Who cares about the room when you are there to see places. The best thing about Casa Hotel is its proximity to the MTR station, very convenient. Downstairs are retail shops, restaurants, and money changers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and well located hotel at good rate”
Reviews.Author: farout75
Reviews.Content: The Casa Hotel in Hong Kong was a stab in the dark which turned out to be a great value and made for a very pleasant stay. It is in the middle of Kowloon and the front door is within one minute of the entrance to the Yau Ma Tei station of the super-clean MTR Metro system and within minutes of excellent though humble dining establishments. It is also adjacent to the Temple Street Night Market. The rooms are small.....as seems to be the rule in Hong Kong hotels. Our room was a twin which measured just over 9 feet wide and 11 feet long. Within that measurement was an absolutely TINY bathroom of about 4'x4'. It was actually a shower stall with a sink and toilet. It is water-sealed from the remainder of the "suite" and other than having to secure those things you wish to keep dry, presented no issue. The room had a modern design with a small but efficient closet and a new flatscreen tv. The beds were firm but comfortable and the air conditioning was excellent. The hotel's lobby was on the first level up from the groundlevel entry(in the USA it would be called second floor.) Here was a smallish common area with modern and comfortable seating and there are large aquaria with large golden (gourami?) fish, giving the area a peaceful and welcoming feel in spite of its constantly busy front desk. The staff were responsive and helpful to us in every way. All in all, the Casa was a significant bargain as it provided all we needed in a convenient location at a nightly rate of $70 US. This price is unheard of in Hong Kong for what seemed to me a 3 and a half star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredible location for the money”
Reviews.Author: tangojohnDallas
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a great location. Within the block it sits on is an underground station. On the next corner is the A-21 airport bus stop. Costs 33 hong kong dollars to be transported from that to the airport. The street behind it is the Temple street night market. It has grocery, restaurants, and most anything you need within a few blocks. Rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny. Everything in the bathroom is combined. When you shower it sprays all over the toilet and sink. Great water pressure. This hotel was incredibly clean, has good linens and towels, and a decent bed. My only real complaint is the elevators are very busy in the morning and the wait time can be a bit long. Overall if you are looking for a great value then this hotel is it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: tintintinin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Casa hotel for just 1 night. Perfect if you just need a clean room with a nice bed to sleep in. If you're looking for something luxurious, go elsewhere. It location on Nathan road with Mongkok and the night markets close is perfect for shopping. The small lobby was not on the ground floor and could accomodate 10 people max. They had a small storage room where they keep your luggage if your room is not ready yet when you check in. Staff are helpful and cheerful enough compared to other HK hotels. They had our room ready at 10AM despite the hotel being fully booked the day before. Triple Room had enough space for three adults to move in but it had a smoked glass wall to seperate the bathroom from the room. Since I was travelling with friends, it did not afford me the privacy that I needed to do my thing. You could not see thru the glass but I prefer a solid wall. The hotel offered free WIFI and the speed was good enough to surf on the internet and to download email. Room amenities were basic but everything I needed for a 1 night stay was there. Overall, the hotel offered value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value room in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_DW_1985
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said previously the rooms are tiny especially the toilet/shower room, however this is to be expected in Hong Kong and this hotel is great in so many other ways. It is in a great location right next a metro station, the bus stop from the airport is just across the street and it is a very plesant walk into town. It has many nice restaurants and shops nearby for convenience. The jade market, night market and a lovely temple are just around the corner. The staff in the hotel were very polite and helpful at all times. If, like me, you are travelling to HK to spend all day sight seeing and just want a nice clean, convenient room to return to to sleep in (at a great price) then this is perfect. If you want a hotel room to spend time sitting in and like a large bathroom then you won't like this, but you will probably pay a lot more for your room in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and tiny bathroom-not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Marshy8
Reviews.Content: I'm coming with a big luggage due to this is my last destination after Shenzhen and Macau..Then, I need to carry the heavy luggage to get in the small lift that only can be fit for 2 person and 1 luggage. Then, the tragedic story begins with a really small room, just like you're coming to a dwarf room. I booked for double room and share tho room with my friend. And guess what, we don't even can put our luggage and each time, we should take turn to open it. ANd the most uncomfortable things is with the bathroom, the size is really small..There's no place for shower, because the space is only for the washtafel and toilet..What a terrible night I should spent. I'm truly didn't recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Too small rooms, claustrophobic rooms”
Reviews.Author: charlie769
Reviews.Content: They gave me a sort of "bullet" room, I couldn't even open my luggage!!. No closet, and toilet and shower all together in a 1mt.per 1 square meter place. I changed the romm, but this "upgrade" costed me 35 more dollars per day. The other room was slightly bigger. Not much more. I would not recommend it, unles you pay less than 100 US dollars per day.

Reviews.Title: “the shower....”
Reviews.Author: Pyongyangsucks
Reviews.Content: Reviews are correct - very close to Yau Ma Tei station. Have a few steps to climb to get to the lift to get to the reception. But there's a "lift to get to the lift" if you have heavy luggage. Check-in is a lengthy process as you are required to sign some paperwork. Got my single room and it is really small. And the shower.... I was not expecting a wet bathroom. Maybe I didn't give the reviews a thorough look or the photos submitted were deceiving. You take a shower and you get everything wet. I was wondering if all other room types are the same. But it is not the end of the world. Just plan to use the toilet before you shower! Some noise of doors slamming, and you can also hear the maids in the morning, but again, nothing unbearable. But for me, a huge change from the hotel I stayed the night before. Well, if you are on a budget, this is an ok place. The money exchange at the hotel entrance does not offer the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Really small room & uncomfortable bathroom/toilet”
Reviews.Author: JazzieTea
Reviews.Content: I totally agree to Daisy's comments on "I will definately NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.” ". I stayed in Casa Hotel for 2 nights recently. The rooms were way too small, and Casa Hotel charged the full fees even though one intends to cancel the room. So, it was too late for me to change to another hotel because of the huge sum I have paid for Casa. I know of another much better hotel in HK Island charging only 1 night of room rate if the cancellation is made after surpassing the 48-hour cancellation timeframe. Since Casa Hotel charged the full rate, I expected a better service and quality of the hotel, but alas, I was greeted with a pathetically small room with dirty walls and ceiling. We even had to change the room due to the 1st room had a leaking bathroom, causing the adjacent walls and carpet floor to be wet. In all the rooms that I had been to (I booked 3 standard double rooms for my family & friends), the bathrooms consisted of frosted glass partitions, which meant your room partner could actually see the outline of your body (although not clearly) while you took a shower! Furthermore, the bathroom door was not totally covered up, leaving a gap at the top of the glass door where the toilet odour could leak into the rest of the room. The whole bathroom would be wet after one completed his/her shower, since the area was too small with no proper partitions between the wet and dry areas. There was no fridge in the room, no dressing mirror on top of the work table (only a full-length mirror was available near the bedroom door), no proper coffee/tea cups (only glasses were available) and definitely no spoons/stirrers as well. There were also insufficient storage spaces for the guests. The lifts were small and each time 1 lift could only squeeze in about 6 people. If you have luggages, then there will be even fewer people that can squeeze into the lift. The only good thing about this hotel is the accessibility to the Yau Ma Tei MTR station (only about 15 or 20 walking steps away from the hotel!) and the street-shopping areas like Temple Street, Ladies Street, Sai Yeung Choi Street etc. around the Mongkok area. I would not recommend this hotel to any traveler seeking value for money. But if one insists on accessibility to MTR stations, by all means go ahead and give the hotel a try and judge it for yourself. There are definitely much better hotels elsewhere with about the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room With Bathroom Shower Head ontop of the toilet (All-In-One Shower, Toilet and Sink)”
Reviews.Author: Tommy111111
Reviews.Content: The Casa Hotel standard double room is extremely small, as soon as you walk in the door you take two small steps before you hit the bed. Behind the room door is a small cubical, which has an all-in-one bathroom shower head, toilet and sink in the one area. This bathroom/toilet area is extremely small. You will not be able to fit in the toilet to go to the toilet properly; if you are bigger than the average asian, you will not fit in the bathroom/toilet area at all! No one can fit in the shower to have a shower. If you turn on the shower head, you will get everything wet, including the toilet and wash basin as it is all in the same area. After raising our concerns with the hotel admin staff, they said that this is the standard and provided us with the option to upgrade to a larger room which costs 100 - 300 HK more. From visual inspection of the premium room, the bathroom/toilet area is slightly larger, but still not adequate to fit us in for a proper shower (maybe a very unhealthy skinny short person, but not an average person). Having said all this, the hotel staff was very respectful and did not disagree with us about the bathroom being small. They were helpful by showing us the larger rooms to see if we would like to upgrade. We booked the Casa hotel through wotif.com. After contacting wotif.com with our concerns, then calling wotif.com on the HK toll free number, the wotif.com admin staff was very helpful and assisted us with cancelling our booking with the hotel straight away. The wotif.com admin staff confirmed with us that they would not take any cancellation fees, as we have already stayed our first night, and also agreed to stay out our 2nd night (since Casa was going to charge us for 2 nights stay). Moral of the story: 1. Don't book Casa hotel standard room if you want to take a shower. 2. Always book your hotels through WOTIF.COM, as the admin staff are very helpful. We have always booked through wotif.com, and will always do so in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Mae T
Reviews.Content: Near to MTR exit, within minutes of walk. Nearby convenience store eg 7-11. Easy to get food just behind the hotel. Room is consider ok but small, especially the bathroom..quite difficult to move around for plus size travellers..reasonable price among HK hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Small and accessible”
Reviews.Author: Eugene L
Reviews.Content: Reasonably cheap hotel which is very accessible. 5 mins walk to MTR station. Fantastic location. Rooms are clean but small.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: froggyfran
Reviews.Content: A standard room at the Casa Hotel is perfect for budget travellers expecting no frills. The room is small but clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom is a wet room with a decent shower. The location of the hotel is fantastic, a 20 second walk from the Yau Ma Tei MTR Station in Kowloon. It is next to Nathan Road and Temple Street Night Market, which is always a good attraction on the way to bed. The window is facing the inside of the building, and there is an air con so the room is always fairly cool. The negative points would be that despite being very clean, the sheets on the bed were not changed everyday and that the tea bags used were hardly ever replaced. Also, the staff at the reception were very polite but not helpful at all. Everytime we asked them for information, they did not know, and even asked us why we wanted to visit a given place, which was a main tourist attraction!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy and very accessable”
Reviews.Author: mgerb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa for 4 nights. The rooms are really small and the bathrooms are even smaller. The shower in the bathroom is not great at all, and it's right above the sink, so prepare for everything to get wet, however I've been living in Korea for a few years now and these types of showers are typical. It's really not that bad!! The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was also very very clean. We got clean towels every day. There's a cafe on the 2nd floor (Casa Cafe) and they do a really nice breakfast for HK$28 including proper tea or coffee. They also do lunch. It's not even a block from the MTR subway and the bus from the airport (BUS A21) stops opposite the hotel, and the pick up point is also only a block away. It's about HKD33 to take the airport bus. Really convenient! I would definitely recommend it. It might not be the best hotel in Hong Kong, but we were hardly "home" anyways since we were out exploring every day. Coming back from that, the bed was probably the most comfortable bed in Hong Kong. :) Really enjoyed my stay there. Just one thing: They do have a HKD300 deposit - which we didn't know of until we arrived. The staff were very friendly - even when we arrived at midnight to check in.

Reviews.Title: “The room was horribly small”
Reviews.Author: totoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August 2011 as part of a solo travel. On the good sides the location of the hotel is ok, on Nathan Road. Also the hotel is clean. But frankly the rest was totally disappointing. I had a single room that was amazingly small, even in HK standards. And i was all the more angry about it that I was paying over 75 euros a night! To have such a small room for this price is clearly unacceptable considering there are better hotel around for the same price. I finally decided to move to another hotel where i got for the same price a room 3 times bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sherrie79
Reviews.Content: Casa Hotel is very conveniently located in that it is just a stone's throw away from Yaumatei MTR station. There is also a direct bus which goes to the airport at a very reasonable price - the exact amount I have forgotten. The interior of the hotel is fairly new though the exterior is that of a very old building. Room rates are reasonable for that particular part of Hong Kong (HK). We got a deluxe room. While I had gone with the expectation that rooms in HK are small, I had not expected it to be so small, especially the washroom! The toilet "walls" are made of frosted glass so it can be a little embarrassing. Moreover, there toilet door has a opening at the top which means your room mate can practically hear everything that you do in the toilet! Otherwise, the room is fairly clean with a small flat screen TV and kettle. It is decent for a short stay. Prepare for a long wait for the small sized lifts every morning as guests check out with their luggages. Would I stay here again? Maybe. But I might pay a bit more to stay at the newer Langham which is down the road.

Reviews.Title: “small room!”
Reviews.Author: jas_yeo
Reviews.Content: the room is so small that i had to upgrade it. even the upgraded room is small! i hardly had space to walk! the toilet is so small that you can't really turn much. the only good thing about this hotel is the free wifi & location. it's 3min walk to the MTR station - yau ma tei. and there's 7-11 and food nearby. and it's walking distance to all the night markets. however, i'll say it's still worth it for the amount i paid for. the free wifi & location does compensate the small room i had.

Reviews.Title: “clean but very small”
Reviews.Author: christineyph
Reviews.Content: The room is clean but very small. The location is good, half minutes reach the MTR station(subway station). The bus stop is infront the hotel only.The place is noisy, cant sleep too late cause the hotel face the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Valued for money”
Reviews.Author: Mild-Jesper
Reviews.Content: The staff are ok and very helpful. For business is ok but for family, the room is too small. The location perfect easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great service and value”
Reviews.Author: theskaven
Reviews.Content: $75/night in one of the best locations in Hong Kong? With free wireless Internet and free breakfast? Yes you can! As others have noted in this space, the rooms are very small. The bathroom is even smaller. But this is the perfect place to stay if you want to be near the action of Temple St for a low cost. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very attentive. If you believe that a hotel is where you sleep and not where you spend your day, if you are comfortable in a smaller room, and if you like free breakfast and good value, this is the place to stay. It will be my choice from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Small and Basic”
Reviews.Author: cheeselatte
Reviews.Content: First time to Hong Kong and sis booked this hotel as part of a travel package. Location was great cos you're just 5min walk from the train station. We took a direct bus from the airport and walked a little before reaching. There are lots of signages on the streets of HongKong, so you really have to look out for the logo "C" outside. The room was incredibly small, needless to mention about the bathroom. You practically have no where to maneuver while you shower in front of the sink. Not a comforting place to return to after a long day. But if you just needed somewhere to sleep in, I guess this place will do. The good thing was the free wifi available, so you get to chat on viber, whatsapp your friends and go on facebook! This is a cantonese speaking place, sadly I don't know how. People in the touristy places can speak english but not everywhere. You could speak in Mandarin but just a warning, they do kind of look down on you if they think you're from the Mainland. (Of course, this is purely my own opinion.) So, stick to english if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonable price...”
Reviews.Author: raquelchia
Reviews.Content: The most important things that matter to me: the cleanliness and the price. The sheets were comfy, the toilets were sparkling clean. As with most hotels in Hong Kong, the room was really small and the toilet was 3 steps away from our beds. But the size wasn't affecting us too much. Location was quite good, just 3 mins away from MTR. Nearby are convenience stores and restaurants. I would say reasonably good neighborhood. Worst thing was that the walls were a little thin. All staff were quite friendly, cept for the cleaning ladies talking on top of their voices next to our thin walls. But didn't really happen during the sleeping night times. Overall, I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you are just demanding a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: monstertoe
Reviews.Content: The location is well situated, just within 5 mins from the MTR station. The toilet was separated by glasses (with less transparent sticker). You may find embarrassed if you are not too close with your friend staying with you. On the other hand, as it is located in a busy road, a bit noisy there. But I think it is charging at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for feeling relaxed after a day's walking”
Reviews.Author: kev_sh
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriends decided on Casa Hotel after looking through the reviews on Tripadvisor. No doubt this hotel's location is excellent, being just 1 minute from the MTR and within walking distance to Mongkok, where lots of shopping is. However, one point I felt I really need to hi-light to travellers choosing their hotel are the size and layout of the toilets. The lot of us were prepared for small toilets but upon checking in to our room, we still got a rude shock. We initially booked for the standard room, and for this room type, the bathing area is non-existent. The toilet has just got enough space for the wash basin and the toilet boil - so if you wanted to shower, you have to do so IN FRONT of the wash basin (the area where you would stand when you wanted to wash your face), and shower over the basin and the toilet bowl. This means that everything in the toilet would be wet after you bath. We eventually decided to do an upgrade to the deluxue room (at extra charge) - the bathroom was just slightly better with a small area you could shower next to the wash basin. However, there was no shower curtain so everything you put on the ledge above the wash basin would still get wet (as in, really wet). I would say this hotel is still stayable if you are really just looking for a place to sleep after a day and nothing else, but if I had a choice, I would choose other hotels that I now know in that area for around the same price. A tip for travellers - Consider hotels which the Airport Express shuttle buses stop at instead. These hotels are usually more 'proper' and not all of them are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for family with toddler!”
Reviews.Author: Jayjust
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room and totally regretted it, although the only plus point is the location, which is near to YMT Mtr. The room wasnt comfy, beds were hard, cleanliness is so terrible, toilet was so small that i cant even shower for my less than 2 years old toddler. Dislike the unfriendly and unhelpful staff! Worst of all the lights in the room was so dim and we could hear our neighbours during wee hours... sigh! What an experience!

Reviews.Title: “A shoebox in a great location”
Reviews.Author: greenlight26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casa Hotel a couple of weeks ago and I must say that this is a small hotel in all regards. Despite that, it's in a great location on Nathan Road, accessable to everything. The MTR is just yards from the hotel. The rooms have been modernized to pleasant IKEA type look which is nice. I had a single room which is tiny as well as the bathroom, you don't have much room to move around in the bathroom or even to close the glass door - but if you are there just for sleeping and a shower the price cannot be beat. As for the service I would rate that as just average, some of the staff was friendly and some not so. They supply one electrical adapter per room and would not supply an extra one when asked, so I went to Temple Street and bought one for a measly $8 HKD. Not much but inconvient. The room cost $70 USD per night which is a good deal for the area where it is located.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to swing your cat, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: TurfMerchant
Reviews.Content: Very small room, I paid for a single but got a twin. You would want to be very close friends with your travel partner staying in this twin! As previously noted the bathroom is miniscule - actually you can perform all bathroom obligations from the one position... The view from the 11th floor at the back is stunning, if you're as fascinated as I am by bamboo scaffolding on HK construction sites... Breakfast isn't included, put available from the cafe. When did 11 baked beans start to be considered a 'portion'? That said, clean, checked in early, helpful staff, and yes, close to the Metro, free pair of slippers :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were helpful in advising which airport bus to take to the hotel. Overall, room is clean & hotel in good location, walking distance to Yau Ma Tei mtr, Mongkok & even Tsim Tsai Tsui. Only issue is small toilet & room

Reviews.Title: “Stayable for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: RaymondChu
Reviews.Content: Been to HK few journeys, this time with group of friends. Followed them to try Casa as 1 couple have stayed there before. Worth it for the price paid. Positives: Very convenient, Mtr exit less than 1 minute walk. 7-11 & K-Mart just downstairs. Few cafes & eateries within walking distance. Temple Street just behind the hotel. Room renovated modernly with small LCD TV. Stayed Deluxe Room enough space for couple stay for 3-5 nites, 2 luggage (25") All staff, reception guard & house keeper seems friendly. Fast & smooth check-in, book & fully paid by Agoda Negatives: 1 couple friend stayed Standard Room, too small, for 1-2 nite with small luggage is OK Bathroom is a bit small but usable, even smaller for standard room Request for highest floor cause a bit noisy as it is facing main Nathan Road Lack of shopping compared Mongkok & TST area.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: chuntruong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hong Kong for a week (06.03.11 - 12.03.11). We had a double room (416) and single room (413) on fourth floor. The rooms were compact - space for bed, toilet/shower, small wardrobe, small desk and bedside table. We managed to fit our two luggage cases (standing up). The back of the hotel backs on to temple street market and the residential flats (see photo). Room 413 had the view of a high rise tower block undergoing works. They were conducting works nearby from about 8am each day. All rooms have a kettle, hair dryer, TV and air con unit. Iron can be provided on request. Beds are smaller than UK ones and harder but we found this quite comfortable. The shower/toilet unit was the biggest down side. When you shower everything will get wet. As there is no separating wall this also means that the room smells a bit damp. Glass is opaque so you can see the outline of the person in the shower/toilet. Generally the room was clean and was cleaned on daily basis so you get new towels and stuff. Mini toiletories are provided but we used out own. No soap/hand wash so we had to buy our own. The shower was good and powerful but there is no hot water in the basin tap. Reception is located on the first floor and the cafe on the second floor. Two (small) lifts serve the hotel. You will have to provide a 300 HK dollar deposit (refunded on checking out). You can leave yur luggage with reception even after you have checked out (which is what we did as our flight was 11pm). There is no safe facilities at the hotel but it is secure and there is usually a porter at ground floor entrance most of the time. There is a small money exchange counter on ground floor entrance but rates generally within HK were not so good so I would advise that you change money in UK. Plus my credit card company gave me a better exchange rate (even taking into the 2% handling charge) so I brought bigger items on my card rather than using cash. Most places will take credit card but not the markets and smaller shop units in big shopping centres (such as computer centres in Sum Sui Po and Mong Kok) would charge a fee or give you a higger price if not paying with cash. The best thing about the hotel was the location. Yau Ma Dai station is literally around the corner (2 mins away) and you can get the green and red lines on MTR from this station. Hotel is on Nathan Road which runs all the way down to Tsim Sha Yui. There is a 7 eleven two stores away and a bigger supermarket type shop (BLT) about 3 mins away (across the road). A number of buses run on Natahn Road, including a shuttle bus to and from the airport (A21) costing 33 HK dollars one way. Temple market is at the back of the hotel and Mong Kok is a 5-10 minute walk away, which was great for doing some serious shopping then coming back to the hotel for a nap/rest before heading out again. There are cafes and restaurants galore nearby. Nathan Road is also littered with gold/watches/jewellery stores. There is also free wi fi internet acces at the hotel which was a huge bonus as most hotels we looked at would have charged (a premium rate) for this. Overall this hotel suited our purpose - cheap but in an ideal location. We would probably stay again but pay extra for an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ezekiel_77
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant and fuss-free room. Staff are attentive and helpful. Only downer is the tiny bathroom but it's expected of hotels of this price range. But the location is exceptional. Bus stop just in front of the hotel, a minute's walk from Yau Ma Tei MRT, a 7-11 next door, Temple St just behind the hotel, and several good restaurants nearby. I would recommend this hotel based on the low price and of course the superb location!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but small”
Reviews.Author: Gerald88
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other hotels in kowloon, I would have to say that this hotel is on the cheap side. However i stayed in the single room for 2 nights and have to say that the toilet and washroom is located in the same small cubicle and was really space constrained. Plus side was the locality as well as free internet. Dont expect hotel rooms but expect small hostel-like rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jessica097
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Jan 2011. Booked a single room but was upgraded to a double. The room itself is big enough for me, not sure how 2 people would feel about the size though. Like many previous reviews stated, bathroom is quite small, it's a wet room basically. This might be a problem for some(not me). Things I like about it: Location and price. Many good and inexpensive restaurants nearby. Things I don't like: Thin walls, I could hear people talking in the hallway and even the next room sometimes! And mattress a bit too hard for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet cozy”
Reviews.Author: mister_euphoria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than 3mins walk away from the MTR. The hotel's reception is at 2nd floor. The entrance of the hotel has a security, feels just like a normal apartment. The hotel main door will be locked past 1am. So if you're late back to hotel after that time, you'll have to ring the bell to get the staff to open the door for you. It's kinda troublesome, but it's for the hotel guests safety. The complimentary WIFI is good. Just need to get the login ID n password from the staff, and configure my laptop to access the web. And the staffs are really very friendly and approachable. When I was checking out, they saw me with several luggage, they offer to help me to get a cab to the airport, and at a cheaper price too. And they even help me to carry my luggage down to the street. But the standard room I got is really small. Lucky I was alone, had more space to place my luggage. The bathroom is walled with translucent glass, and is also very small, hard to move around inside the toilet. Can't even hang my clothes inside the bathroom, coz it'll be all wet. Oh yes, there's no hair dryer in the room, if you need one, you'll have to request from staff. There's a cafe beside the hotel named Casa cafe. The food are pretty nice and at reasonable price. Reminder, the MTR station has no escalator nor lift up to the street, it's kinda troublesome for me. But overall, it's still a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location. Tiny Room.”
Reviews.Author: Jasper_Ng
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at Casa Hotel. The location is fantastic as its next to Ya Ma Tei MTR station (Exit C) *remember C for Casa Hotel. There is a short staircase from the ground level to the lift level so you have to carry the luggage up. The guard sitting there did help me when I was carry a lot of luggage up down that stairs. The check in was a breeze for me. Deposit HKD300 have to be paid. The 2 lifts are a disaster. The IQ for the 2 lifts are not linked. So if lift A arrives, lift B will not cancel out itself. During peak hours, you can wait very long for the lift. The room is just nearly the size of the bed, compliment with a tiny bathroom. Just good enough for a good rest after a whole day of shopping and sight seeing at Hong Kong. Good stable fast wifi internet. With the lower cost at a premium location, this is considered the best value hotel around.

Reviews.Title: “Location Good but I would not stay Again”
Reviews.Author: saggo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from travel in Japan and Hong Kong and the point of difference is the hospitality and this hotel was the least interested or tourist focussed i came across. There was no help or interest at all with information, welcome hotel services, bags to lift just processing the payment (have to leave $300 HKD deposit on check in) and pay up front as i had gone through booking.com (who were great) even with 3 staff behind the counter at 11.30 pm on New Years Eve and no other customers - as i was trying to rush to get my accom sort to get to fireworks and my first impressions did not improve. My room size was quite big, bathroom yes you have to leave shower to last as everything is left wet. Did not really have a problem with that as i understand this set up, room is sort of modern but somehow the hallways and general feel did not lend to modern. Walls very thin as other reviewers mentioned. Breakfast $31 HKD with tax. Check out was slow as there was a family booking in and all staff inc manager were focussed on working that out .. i had to get pushy to get service and there was no general friendliness again on check out .. I moved from here (pre planned) into a smaller room with just a lovely manager/owner who was almost apologising for the small room and i would rather climb over a suitcase with the friendliness or pay the extra and stay 4 star. This is my third trip to HK with a variety of accoms and i do prefer more customer friendly hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was so near to the mtr station.”
Reviews.Author: sanfong
Reviews.Content: We were suprised that the hotel was just less than a minute walk from YMT MTR station. Check was a breeze and we went into our room immediately. The lift was often crowded as it was small and both shaft served to 14th floor. We were suprised again when the moment we open the room. It was not quite small as we exected and read online reviews. The toilet was small and usuall the whole place will be wet after shower. Those people with long legs may have to turn sideway when using the toilet bowl. The bed was very comfortable. But the partition was not sound proof as you can hear people switching on lights and closing doors. If you stay near the main road, you could hear the traffic. But overall the hotel room facilities were quite complete and for people like us stays out whole day will not really bothered by the limited space. The location was great. There are guardian, sasa, 7 eleven and small stores nearby. The famous Jenny biscult was just one road away. And the steam milk was around too. And the Song Ji dessert was around too. And those shops selling chcken rice and wanton mee were awesome too. I will definately go back to this hotel this year again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Shaowei
Reviews.Content: Bathroom especially tiny but location makes up for everything if you're just using the hotel to sleep. Night market nearby was good fun so plan to stay out late!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: xiaosin
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel with cheap price..$70/night to upgrade to a bigger room.. have free wireless throughout the hotel Pretty small rooms (fit about 3 big luggages, only one can be on the floor) with glass washroom walls..could see the shadow of the person doing in the washroom.. find a cockroach in our bedroom in one of the nights we stay Great location - less than 5 mins walking distance away from MTR One of the security in the main floor is pretty nice. Always push the button for elevator for us when we enter the hotel. Did not even take our tips after he kill the cockroach for us..

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: TilipTip
Reviews.Content: Small room, but very clean and excelent hotel, in the center on nathan road, 30 meters from the Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LiMo2009
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the location of Casa Hotel - just steps away from Yau Ma Tei MTR, directely on bustling Nathan Road and just a short walk away from Ladies Market and Temple Street Night Market. The hotel was a real bargain because of the rate I got booking through a travel website. The good features were the modern interiors, free WiFi, cleanliness and comfortable bed, the turn offs were the extremely small bathroom with the shower head just sticking out of the wall in between the toilet and the washbasin, so everything was wet after the shower, and that the walls were in need of a new paint job. Also, the staff could have been friendlier when they told me I had to wait until 2pm for check-in when I arrived really tired after the overnight flight. The walls were thin so the room was a bit noisy and the view wasn't very nice, yet I really liked the great value I got for very little money and the unbeatable location. I felt at home at Casa Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: CairnsAussie52
Reviews.Content: For a brief stay this hotel was adequate with its small rooms, excellent location in Kowloon and very reasonable tariff. WiFi was accessible and complimentary and room service very good. I must mention that the room for a single occupant was very small with single bed and bathroom, shower and toilet all in one small space.

Reviews.Title: “Near MTR Yau Ma Tei Stn”
Reviews.Author: pusangala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small but clean and near the MTR station which is about 30 meters away, it is found the Nathan Road, the staffs knows and speaks english. There is free wifi available, recommended for single traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kowloongolfer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly for the traveller on the budget. It isn't flash but it is fine. I liked the location alot. The reason being is the short distance it takes to get to tourist places. The room was fine. The shower and toilet area was small but I didn't mind. Staff were helpful but could have gone the extra yard with service when I first checked in. They could have mentioned about the breakfast service. I found out about it later and could have bought breakfast tickets instead of having to find 31 hk dollars in cash all the time. The breakfast was fine. I thought the hotel charge was fair. I have to rate the hotel good to very good for what your paying.

Reviews.Title: “would prefer shower seperate to toilet”
Reviews.Author: rocky_bay58
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in a hurry, overall it was ok, a place to stay. Good points: - location, smack bang in the hustle and bustle of Nathan Rd, pretty much the main drag. Literally a few steps to the MTR underground which is easy to use. Fairly short walk to Ladies Market Room cleanlyness overall was fine, fairly modern decor Staff spoke some English, enough to answer some basic questions Bad points: The shower and bathroom were in one tiny cubicle, so showering yourself meant showering the toilet and the ground, too (not very appealing). I stayed in a single room, the cheapest there was. The view from the window into the backalleys was very unpleasant, best to keep the shades closed. You also can't expect fresh air when you open the window, as strong cooking and other smells quickly infiltrate the room When first entering the closed up room the smell is slightly unpleasant (I have had worse though), just a lack of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for short trip”
Reviews.Author: Backy01
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel has very very smalls rooms, but they are very clean with everything you need for the time you'll spend there (hairbrush, teethbrush and paste, TV...). I really enjoyed the location of this hotel (Nathan's Road) near a metro station. People at the reception were very kind and accepted to take care of our luggage the all afternoon of our last day. I surely will return in this hotel in case I'll return in Hong Kong one day !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi, but small bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: tangerin
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are knowledgeable, and also quite friendly. The room is small, but since i m a lone traveller, size is not really a big issue. i liked it for their free wifi, and the room has basic items like electric kettle, hairdryer, etc. What i liked best is their location. Because i m a female single traveller, its location on a busy street and close proximity to the mtr station is a big plus point! The only downside is the size of the washroom. Its simply too SMALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker hotel”
Reviews.Author: anne8888
Reviews.Content: This is more for the budget conscious backpacker traveler. The rooms are tiny - like dorm rooms. The bathroom is so tiny you have to take a shower over the toilet. The rooms are clean. The plusses are- free local calls, free wifi, & very close to the MTR. Don't expect help from staff if you have heavy luggage- they were no help. This hotel is for people who just want a cheap, clean, safe place to sleep & shower in.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect too much”
Reviews.Author: DomingosLao
Reviews.Content: Low cost , with great location, less than 1 minute from the MTR station. But the room & wash(bath) room is very very small, even you could not turnaround and have a big movement indside that tiny washroom. The bed..small, and uncomfortable....I have chosen the double bed, but I believe if I choose two twin bed and move them together, we will have more space..==' And...we could hear the sound outside the room....too bad, but luckly, our room is not facing the street!! but unfortuently, there got maintance upstairs, and we could not have a sleep in the afternoon while we were extremely tried.... they said free wifi, but i could not use it,...=='

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't mind the small room and toilet”
Reviews.Author: bunnie83
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just few steps away from the MTR exit. Temple Street is right behind and there are many useful shops such as 7-11 around. The room is clean, new and definitely small. We were prepared for it, since this is Hong Kong we're talking about. The toilet is designed such that you have to bathe right in front of the sink and toilet bowl (everything gets wet) and the size of it could be a problem for bigger sized travellers (we are average Asian sizes). We didn't have any issues with noisy traffic but rather had noisy neighbours who broke our sleep by speaking loudly in the corridor for 15 mins or so in the early morning. The lifts are pretty slow as well. Service is nothing much to rave about but at least they can speak English. Finally, free wifi is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews far too generous, many better values available.”
Reviews.Author: Unemployed-Traveler
Reviews.Content: For Hong Kong, the Casa hotel is not as great a deal as it seems. It is a nice clean 2 star, with tiny (size of 2 queen beds) standard rooms. Other options in Kowloon for either the same price or $10-$12 USD more, offer real rooms, with an actual shower (Casa has ghetto hand held, drain on the the floor around your toilet showers.) Other options on Hong Kong island are good too. If you want something cheap, look for slightly out of the way hotels at Fortress hill (City Garden comes to mind). Overall, if you REALLY don't care about the room size, then sure stay here. But when you can get so much better VALUE for a budget hotel, keep looking. Unless they make the rooms here less than $45 US a night it's priced too high (if you are getting something like that, then ok stay here). I'm paying $60 USD and I feel totally ripped, when for $70 I could be in a real hotel, with real facilities (i.e. bar soap, a separate shower, a closet, floor space not taken up by luggage!) Good parts, internet access, so I can leave this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel along Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: pheeanne
Reviews.Content: The room was a little bit small but otherwise comfortable, and priced just right for budget travelers like us. It takes a while to get on the elevator since there's only 2 with a maximum capacity of 6 on each but if you're in no hurry, then there's really no problem.

Reviews.Title: “VERY great location, room too small”
Reviews.Author: notophe
Reviews.Content: Location wise: VERY GOOD!! right in the middle of shopping district and next to MTR yau ma tei exit C. Walking distance to Ladies market, Temple street, etc ROOM: too small even with hkd 80 upgrade. make sure you ask for the highest upgrade ( i'm not sure if it's worth if compared to other hotels with higher price but no upgrade required) BATHROOM: openly connected to the bedroom which sometimes makes it disgusting with the smell coming out of it. SLEEP QUALITY: make sure you close the windows tight... busy street = noisy nights!

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to upgrade for best results”
Reviews.Author: steiff1947
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Casa Hotel and were extremely pleased at the location, friendliness, price and service. It is a must to upgrade your room for a lengthy stay even though we were out and about most of the time. The few extra dollars per night to upgrade to the executive suite is well worth it and still less than the cost of most other rooms. Enjoy Hong Kong! We sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Your Room Immediately”
Reviews.Author: JoeHawaii
Reviews.Content: Having found this last minute deal over the internet on the cheap, I was prepared for the worse as from previous reviews I expected the rooms to be be extremely small and extremely noise due to the hotel being next to Nathan road. What eventuated was worse. To state that the rooms were small was an understatement. Believe it when people say when the room is small...it is bloody damn small! The worse part of the experience though was as the walls are paper thin, you could hear everything next door. So when my neighbour decided to return to his room at 1am and catch up on cable tv for the next 6 hours to satisfy his cable fix, you end up not sleeping a wink. This becomes worse as u realise that the flat screen tv is fixed to the wall and your sleeping with your head literally 30cm away (albeit split by the paper wall) from the blazing tv audio. Next morning these guys are awake at 8am and making more noise. That was the final straw and I immediately went to reception to request for an upgrade. I actually didn't mind paying for a bigger room and also a room away from all the noise. So the next 2 nights were actually a dream and to be honest, I would go back and stay here again because of the rate and convenience, but i should have guessed that you get what you pay for. So my recommendation is definitely to go for the upgrade and u will save 1 restless sleepless night in hk.

Reviews.Title: “Translucent Bathroom Walls & Loud Street”
Reviews.Author: BackstreetsBack
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is located in one of the prime locations in Hong Kong, there is going to be a lot of commotion outside even throughout the night. There is a bus stop directly in front of the hotel, so if you have a room with a window facing this street, you will hear the bus and traffic start up and screech to a halt all through the night, every night. The walls of the bathroom were translucent. I understand they were trying for the 'modern' look, but how is this practical for those who don't wish to show their birthday suits to their roommates? There is no bathtub, or shower curtain at the very least (which is typical in HK mediocre-priced lodging), so naturally, the drain in the floor gets clogged with hair. At least the staff responded efficiently to that problem, which I'm sure occurs often, as they have a designated handyman who comes right in and out. The staff (particularly the gentleman by the entrance) were lovely. They not only helped us with directions, but also came to our aid when we called them at 2AM to report a mysterious knock at our door. What separates this hotel from a hostel is the decor. It's almost as small as a hostel, so if you were thinking of staying here, you may want to consider a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, good for the price...”
Reviews.Author: APRS
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is expensive to get to from New Zealand and accommodation is the same there. I looked and looked on the internet for accommodation and found Casa Hotel. It was ideally situated on Nathan Road, next to the MTR Station and just a short distance from the Temple Street Night Market. Rooms are small in HK, and I mean small! We upgraded to the next size on a special detail and it was well worth it, more room and bigger ensuite! Good staff and no issues. No restaurant in this Hotel but one next door, show your room card for a 10% discount! 7/11 Store next door as well - cheap beer prices! Good air con, and free wireless internet. This hotel is the best location on Kowloon and would stay there again without question. Recommend you upgrade to a better room if possible on arrival, was only NZD$10.00 extra a night. Length of stay was 9 days.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: mygardenbees
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room but ended up in a twin room. Even though the room is small ( all hong kong hotels have small rooms) but clean and good enough for me. The location of this hotel is excellent. It was really convenient for me. Plus, their TV offers a lot of movie channels and i ended up sleeping at an insane time because of all the good movies. Overall, i would love to stay there again the next time i visit Hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL, CLEAN AND SO CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: liyen
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my teen daughter for this shopping trip and the location is very convenient. MTR is 5doors away and bus stops right in front! Was upgraded to deluxe room and faced Nathan Road which is abit noisy but bearable. If you are a light sleeper bring earplugs tho as walls are thin and you may get woken up when neighbor closes his door. Room is rather small and would not recommend this hotel to you if you are claustrophobic. The bathroom is small , standing room shower with frosted glass walls so lack of privacy if you are staying with friend. I chose it only becos of location and price. The staff are excellent tho and brought us what we need pronto. Free wifi is also a major plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Hotel - Small and cosy but i'm not complaining!”
Reviews.Author: bigmidds
Reviews.Content: We booked online through asiarooms.com before arriving and payed for a standard room. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a larger 'family sized' room for a reasonable fee (about £10 extra per night). We paid for the upgarde and couldn't believe what we saw! The room was tiny so i dread to think how big the standard size room would have been!?! Apart from the size of the rooms we have no complaints. The hotel is clean, the rooms are modern and well decorated, the staff are very friendly and the hotel is in an excellent location. Dont let the size of the rooms put you off (aparantly all hotels in H.K. have small rooms), i would reccommend this hotel and i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Bananna668
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have said, yes rooms are small, bed is comfy though. In particular the bathroom is tiny. We had to shower pretty much right on the toilet. But for a bargain price of under $50 AUD per person (including free WIFI), we could not complain. Check in was efficient and staff were helpful, and we were able to store our luggage on the day we checked out for a few hours too. Best thing about this hotel is absolutely the close proximity to the Yau Ma Tei MTR. Step out of the hotel, turn right and in about 30 seconds you are there at Exit C. There is a 7-Eleven to the right of the hotel and plenty of options to choose to eat with snacks and restaurants a-plenty in the area. Temple Street Night Market is only a few minutes away by foot. Despite being on busy Nathan Rd, the rooms were quiet and sleep was not an issue. Only negative would be our friends room which had a small window so limited natural light and their room smelt like wet towels and they couldn't get rid of the smell. Lifts are tiny and so can be difficult to grab one down in the morning during peak times. So all in all I would stay here again if I was on a budget, but otherwise pay a bit extra for a bit of extra room if you need it. For us, we hardly spent any time in the room so Casa was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Small and almost perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: ChloeBo
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly when we arrived a few hours ahead of the check-in time but as the room was ready we were shown the way. Unfortunately I had forgotten that Hong Kong is notorious for small rooms so it was a bit of a shock when we saw it, however, the room was clean, there was a TV and wardrobe space and a wet room...well a small toilet/sink area in the corner of the room surrounded by frosted glass which doubled as a shower. If you're after privacy in your oblutions it's not ideal as the frosted glass doesn't leave anything to the imagination but we had 3 great nights sleep and were close enough to the areas we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for shopping and eating”
Reviews.Author: Ozflyer88
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel cos of price and location, i didnt know what i was going to expect. This was a commercial building and turned into hotel, its about 2 yrs old. The lobby is located on level 1, and the staff was ok (could be more friendly). When we checked in, staff told us if we could upgrade to deluxe room if we found the standard room too small...i eventually did, cos when i opened my room door the twin bed were in front of me, no where else to walk and no where to put suitcase. the toilet was even more ridiculously small, 1mtre square, there was no tub, so you shower between the toilet and the basin. So the deluxe room is a better option, with more shower space and more roomy. The hotels only have two lifts, so during the day it takes a while before the lifts come...and each lift capacity was only 6 and 8 people. One of my biggest concern during this stay was the noise outside, as its located on nathan road, the bus and traffic was non stop day and night, even on the top floor, level 14, i could still hear the traffic and i had a lot of trouble getting to sleep. Despite all that, location was great, 1min walk to mtr and 7-11 right next door, heaps of places to eat, i recommend the congee restuarant and the chicken shop which is next door to it. The hotel restaurant served local snacks and i was surprised it was quite good too. The post office is about 5mins walk, this is quite important for me, as i always have to post things back due to my excessive shopping spree Although the MTR is 1min away, Mongkok is about 15mins walk, i walked back and forth about 3 times, and you dont feel like its 15mins cos as you walk there are heaps of shops, so if you end up too late in Mongkok you can always walk back to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My room was so tiny.”
Reviews.Author: NYTim
Reviews.Content: Casa Hotel is located in Kowloon next to a subway station. It could not have been more convenient. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. By room was so small I could almost touch both walls when I lay on the bed. The toilet, shower and sink are all in one tiny closet like space. The only way to take a shower was to soap up then use the hand held shower-head. My knees banged the wall when I sat on the toilet. Obviously the rooms are designed for people smaller than me - 5 11" When I arrived my bottom sheet was stained but to be fair when I complained they changed it right away. I gave this hotel a thumbs down because of the room size; however if one is less than 5.10" this might be a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: babymild
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small like other hotels in Hong Kong, but clean. Twin bed room is recommended because it is bigger than a double (queen size) bed room. Bath room is only about 1 square metre, and everything is all there ! Anyway, Casa hotel is in a very good location. Only 20 metres to the Exit C of Yau Ma Tei MTR where is very convenient to go to everywhere in HK. It is on the shopping area where you can shop along the road. Reasonable and good tasted foods are plenty and nearby the hotel. Staffs are helpful and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Hotel Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.487-489 Nathan Road, Yau Ma Tei Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
